channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Trump wants US investigators to go to China
How Trump lost the public on coronavirus
item.description: With just 198 days until Election Day, 2020 is in full swing -- even in the midst of the coronavirus crisis. Every Sunday, I outline the top storylines you need to know to understand the upcoming week on the campaign trail. And they're ranked, so the No. 1 story is the most important of the coming week.

item.title: Watch Dr. Fauci correct Fox News host on live TV
item.description: CNN's Anderson Cooper fact-checks recent false and controversial statements made by TV doctors and a Fox News host about the coronavirus.

item.title: Gunman kills at least 9 in rampage across Nova Scotia
item.description: A gunman may have injured up to 10 people in Novia Scotia, including at least one Mountie, in a shooting rampage before he was taken into custody after a manhunt, according to a Canadian law enforcement official.

item.title: Singapore had a model coronavirus response, then cases spiked. What happened?
item.description: Less than a month ago, Singapore was being hailed as one of the countries that had got its coronavirus response right.

item.title: 100,000 gather for funeral in Bangladesh, defying lockdown and sparking outbreak fears
item.description: More than 100,000 people defied Bangladesh's lockdown order on Saturday to attend the funeral of a senior leader of the Islamist party in the district of Brahmanbaria, authorities said.

item.title: In 1911, another epidemic swept through China. That time, the world came together
item.description: In 1911, a deadly epidemic spread through China and threatened to become a pandemic. Its origins appeared to be related to the trade in wild animals, but at the time no one was sure.

item.title: US pastor who defied coronavirus orders is asking people to donate their stimulus checks to church
item.description: A Louisiana pastor who defied state orders and repeatedly held large church services during the coronavirus pandemic is now asking congregants to donate their stimulus checks to the church.

item.title: The Mafia is poised to exploit coronavirus, and not just in Italy
item.description: Earlier this month, there was a funeral procession in the Sicilian town of Messina, in defiance of a nationwide lockdown in Italy.

item.title: Trump's approval rating is down significantly
Johnson missed 5 key coronavirus meetings, but UK government defends his leadership
item.description: A senior UK government figure has defended Prime Minister Boris Johnson's approach to the coronavirus pandemic, following a wide-ranging critique in the Sunday Times newspaper.

item.title: These countries are reopening after coronavirus -- here's how they're doing it
item.description: People in the Czech Republic can now shop at hardware and bicycle stores, play tennis and go swimming. Italians can visit bookshops and laundries, while younger students are returning to classrooms in Denmark. Austria has reopened smaller stores and Germany will follow suit next week.

item.title: Laura Bush and Michelle Obama share hopeful message on Global Citizen concert special
item.description: Former first ladies Laura Bush and Michelle Obama made an appearance Saturday night on the Global Citizen "One World: Together At Home" televised concert special, separately, from their own homes, sharing messages of thanks and hope.

item.title: Country of 12 million has only 4 ventilators
item.description: Covid-19 cases have topped 2.2 million globally and countries around the world are scrambling to buy life-saving equipment as the pandemic places unprecedented demand on hospitals.

item.title: Why Putin's increased contact with Trump may be risky for the US
item.description: President Donald Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin appear to have had more sustained contact with each other in the past two weeks than at any time since 2016, as the Kremlin tries to use the coronavirus pandemic and close personal ties between the two leaders to normalize long-strained relations with Washington.

item.title: Britain's health service is part of its national psyche. It's also on life support
item.description: The makeshift poster is displayed proudly in the window of a London home. "We love the NHS" is written in children's handwriting above a picture of a rainbow. A few doors down the street, another colorful arch is daubed on a bed sheet hanging from a balcony.

item.title: US Southeast is getting hit by another round of severe storms
item.description: The southeastern US is being hit Sunday with another round of severe storms, including damaging winds, hail and possible tornadoes, just a week after more than 100 tornadoes hit the region.

item.title: Powerful Orthodox church refuses to heed the pleas of public health officials
item.description: At first glance, the republic of Georgia has been a success story in the fight against the novel coronavirus: the outbreak in the small Caucasus nation has remained limited, with just 370 official cases as of Friday morning.

item.title: Celebrities unite to show support for underserved communities battling coronavirus
item.description: Celebrities like Snoop Dogg, America Ferrera, Lin-Manuel Miranda and Sean "Diddy" Combs came together to express their support for underserved communities hit hard by the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Global concert raises more than $127M for WHO emergency response fund
Recovered coronavirus patients are testing positive again. Can you get reinfected?
item.description: In South Korea, health officials are trying to solve a mystery: why 163 people who recovered from coronavirus have retested positive, according to the Korea Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (KCDC).

item.title: Why senators got angry with Pence on tense phone call
item.description: Senator Angus King (I-VT) got angry with Vice President Mike Pence on a phone call over the lack of coronavirus testing.

item.title: Hundreds of Rohingya refugees rescued after two months at sea
Watch for the Lyrid meteor shower this week
item.description: The first meteor shower of spring, known as the Lyrid meteor shower, will present a night skywatching show beginning on Sunday evening and peaking on Wednesday night.

item.title: Melania Trump picks up telephone diplomacy during coronavirus crisis
item.description: First lady Melania Trump has spent the last several weeks like the rest of America -- at home.

item.title: Watch: Beachgoers swarm the sand in Florida
item.description: Beaches and parks in Jacksonville, Florida, reopened as more states consider easing restrictions put in place to battle the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Prediction: Doctor discusses when states could be safe
item.description: Dr. Chris Murray, who makes a key prediction model for the coronavirus pandemic, discusses when each state could possibly reopen.

item.title: Matterhorn in Swiss Alps lit up with American flag, messages of hope during coronavirus crisis
item.description: Switzerland's famed Matterhorn mountain was illuminated with an American flag for a few hours as a symbol of solidarity during the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: 'Captain Tom' on raising millions for NHS: 'I'm overwhelmed'
item.description: CNN's Hala Gorani speaks with Tom Moore, the 99-year-old war veteran who raised millions of pounds for the UK's National Health Service (NHS) by walking 100 lengths of his garden.

item.title: Gwyneth Paltrow is auctioning off an Oscars gown for coronavirus relief, a dress she once called 'not Oscars material'
item.description: Gwyneth Paltrow is auctioning off one of her old Oscars dresses to help provide food assistance to people in need during the coronavirus pandemic. But it's not one of her favorites.

item.title: These leaders are being praised for their strategic pandemic response
item.description: Many countries and territories led by women are being praised for their quick and strategic action against the coronavirus pandemic. CNN's Max Foster reports.

item.title: Reboot of beloved 1990's sitcom will include two original cast members
item.description: NBC is giving the hit '90s sitcom "Saved by the Bell" a reboot on its new streaming service, Peacock. The show will include original cast members Elizabeth Berkley and Mario Lopez reprising their roles.

item.title: Surfer gets creative with quarantine guidelines
item.description: Thomas Cervetti hadn't been surfing since January, so he decided to get creative and make a stop-motion video from his apartment.

item.title: 7 digital libraries you can visit from your couch
item.description: Check this out: You can still celebrate National Library Week, which begins Sunday, at home. Here are seven digital libraries with specialized collections you can visit to honor the contributions of our nation's libraries and library workers.

item.title: Optimizing workspaces and the importance of virtual backgrounds
item.description: From the charming bright interiors of New York's Berdorf Goodman restaurant to the rich, Art Deco-inspired accents of Miami's Tides South Beach hotel, designer Kelly Wearstler has transformed commercial and residential projects into some of the world's most distinctive spaces.

item.title: Taylor Swift performs emotional song detailing her mother's cancer battle during home concert
item.description: Taylor Swift performed an emotional song about her mother's battle with cancer during the "One World: Together at Home" live broadcast Saturday night.

item.title: Undefeated boxer Devin Haney denies being racist after saying he would 'never lose to a white boy'
item.description: American boxer Devin Haney has said he is "not a racist" and rejects "discrimination of any kind" after saying that he would "never lose to a white boy".

item.title: Chinese club begins constructing world's biggest soccer stadium for $1.7 billion
item.description: As lockdown restrictions in China to slow the coronavirus pandemic are slowly lifted, one Chinese soccer club aims to get back into the swing of things with aplomb.

item.title: A sports junkie adjusts to life without any sport
item.description: Unless you're Jared Leto living in isolation in the desert, you've probably been impacted by the spread of coronavirus (only teasing, Jared! You're good!)

item.title: Instagram Live battle between Babyface and Teddy Riley was a complete fail
item.description: The highly anticipated Instagram Live battle between Kenny "Babyface" Edmonds and Teddy Riley didn't turn out as expected Saturday night.

item.title: Meet the 73-year-old 'skipping Sikh' raising money to fight the coronavirus crisis
item.description: A keen runner, 73-year-old Rajinder Singh was initially at a loss as to how he was going to keep fit with Britain under lockdown.

item.title: The buzz cut is back -- here's how to get the look
item.description: Under the tutelage of celebrity hairstylist Mark Francome Painter, CNN journalist Dominich Rech gives himself a haircut while at home during the lockdown in London.

item.title: Woman sees piano in tornado rubble, sits down and plays
item.description: Tracy Coats, a piano player and band director, explained her decision to play a piano left standing in tornado rubble at a Tennessee church saying she uses faith to "find peace in the storm." CNN affiliate WTVC reports.

item.title: BBC weatherman takes working from home to a new level
item.description: BBC weatherman Owain Wyn Evans struck internet gold by ending one of his weather reports from home while drumming his show's theme music.

item.title: US President says he will invoke the Defense Production Act to increase production of swabs
Shake Shack, Ruth's Chris and other chain restaurants got big PPP loans when small businesses couldn't
item.description: For local D.C. bakery DC Sweet Potato Cake, $23,000 would have gone a long way.

item.title: White House downplayed early virus concerns
item.description: White House officials downplayed concerns over Covid-19 in late February and early March.

item.title: Trump's approval rating is down significantly
item.description: • OPINION: Trump's stunning flip-flops

item.title: They're 'essential,' can't hide at home and are in danger
item.description: • 'It's OK to not be OK right now.' A month of grief, worry and frustration

item.title: Elton John livestreams performance of 'I'm Still Standing' from his backyard
item.description: While the coronavirus pandemic has forced most of us into our homes, health care workers are still standing on the front lines battling this crisis.
